<url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;71b369c5.1503">   <title>Re: Turnitin Direct version 2.5 building block </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;71b369c5.1503</link>   <description> Positive results so far -<br>Couldn't replicate the other issues either, but not trying that hard.<br><br>------<br>&gt;<br>&gt;1) When a grade is entered and saved into the document viewer, it takes a<br>&gt;while for this to re-appear when the document viewer is subsequently<br>&gt;re-opened.<br>&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;No lag on the submissions I tested<br><br>------<br>&gt;<br>&gt;4) Submitting an invalid file type provides a &quot;null&quot; error when this<br>&gt;should be a notice about acceptable file formats based on our Turnitin<br>&gt;settings. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T16:00:31+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robin Englebright</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;71b369c5.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;7911ec85.1503">   <title>Re: Turnitin Direct version 2.5 building block </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;7911ec85.1503</link>   <description> We are just starting testing, so this list is an excellent (if depressing)<br>starter.<br><br>I had noticed that the new B2 fixed the multiple scroll bars and tab title<br>nonsense...<br><br>And that it had changed the content area items from TurnitinUK to just<br>plain turnitin Assignments<br><br>And the little book logo next to View Assignments seemed to have come<br>adrift. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T14:34:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robin Englebright</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;7911ec85.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;a5ebf635.1503">   <title>Turnitin Direct version 2.5 building block </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;a5ebf635.1503</link>   <description> Hi all,<br><br>Is anyone else using the Turnitin Direct version 2.5 building block? We are currently testing this in a sandbox environment running the April 2014 release and would be interested to hear if anyone else has experienced the following issues:<br><br>1) When a grade is entered and saved into the document viewer, it takes a while for this to re-appear when the document viewer is subsequently re-opened. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T11:05:52+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Richard Dudley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;a5ebf635.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;bae1f5c9.1503">   <title>Re: blackboard social profiles </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;bae1f5c9.1503</link>   <description> We have had spaces on since the start.<br>Staff and students do appreciate the profile picture - it was amazing how quickly our distance learning students added their photos. We haven’t seen much use of spaces, but I think that is because they remain pretty feature poor at present, not having received much love at present. Other tools such as facebook, google+ etc. offer more functionality and people are already using them, so there is no compelling reason for people to switch. I am also hoping that when myEdu finally comes to the UK (no date yet from Blackboard on [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T10:41:14+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>MURRAY M.R.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;bae1f5c9.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;f2cce108.1503">   <title>Re: blackboard social profiles </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;f2cce108.1503</link>   <description> Hello Mark,<br><br>When I used spaces (very briefly) I opted to make the space protected- which meant that users had to request to join the space- which worked for the project I was working on.<br><br>You may wish to choose this setting or choose the 'private' setting which means that you have to search for and add those users you wish to be involved within the space as private sites do not show in searches.<br>[cid:5f7fc476-a5da-4cc9-91e1-6dc01fa3db9f] [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T10:15:13+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Murphy Geraldine</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;f2cce108.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;df1be6af.1503">   <title>Re: blackboard social profiles </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;df1be6af.1503</link>   <description> Hi Jim,<br><br>After a lot of work to verify the privacy of the system I switched it on at City College Norwich from last September. I've run a number of sessions with staff to raise awareness of the capabilities (small study groups, clubs and societies etc), but to be honest although some people have said that they see the potential, I've not seen anyone actively use the system with their students. We've had 413 people (staff and students) who have signed up and created a profile, and 11 Spaces created under our institution (some which I created to promote the [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T10:11:54+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Boon, Chris</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;df1be6af.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;6bd21fdb.1503">   <title>Re: blackboard social profiles </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;6bd21fdb.1503</link>   <description> Has anybody managed to turn on Spaces and keep it within your institution? I was sure Bb said this would be possible, but darned if I can see how.    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T10:06:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mark Gamble</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;6bd21fdb.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;cdaeb33a.1503">   <title>Re: blackboard social profiles </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;cdaeb33a.1503</link>   <description> Hi Jim,<br><br>At Newcastle we decided not to turn it on this academic year for a couple of main reasons:<br><br>1. We didn't think it would offer students a great deal more in its current state<br>2. We were concerned about possible resource implications in resolving queries, possible impersonation issues<br><br>Along with Jim I'd be interested to hear about other people's experiences? [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T10:00:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ashley Wright</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;cdaeb33a.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;fe20a905.1503">   <title>blackboard social profiles </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;fe20a905.1503</link>   <description> Hi<br>We will be turning on bb social profile tools in September. If anyone has any issues, experiences, words of wisdom to share, they will be most gratefully received.<br><br>Cheers<br>Jim Turner LJMU   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T08:49:03+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>James Turner</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;fe20a905.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;16162a61.1503">   <title>qtiworks </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;16162a61.1503</link>   <description> Hi<br>Has anyone successfully integrated QTIworks, and how useful is it<br>QTIworks is an LTI programme that creates sophisticated maths questions. It has a huge database of examples to draw from.<br>https://webapps.ph.ed.ac.uk/qtiworks/<br>jim    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T09:25:20+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Turner, James</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;16162a61.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;593dd73c.1503">   <title>Re: Bb Mobile and the Cookie Disclosure Building Block </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;593dd73c.1503</link>   <description> ?Hi Malcolm<br><br>I hope you are well<br><br>We looked at this and decided we were covered by other points of access to our systems (Portal etc) so we turned it off.<br><br>Peter    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-06T13:37:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Rayment</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;593dd73c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;b3744121.1503">   <title>Bb Mobile and the Cookie Disclosure Building Block </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;b3744121.1503</link>   <description> We are rather late attendees to the Bb Mobile Learn Party (such as it is).<br>Currently we use Blackboard's Cookie Disclosure building block on our Learn instance to keep on the right side of EU legislation and the ICO.<br><br>Unfortunately it does not seem to play well with Blackboard mobile.<br><br>Anyone else seen this and come up with a solution? [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-06T13:03:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>MURRAY M.R.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;b3744121.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;9246565d.1503">   <title>Re: Customising Contextual Help? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;9246565d.1503</link>   <description> Ashley and Joseph,<br><br>Thanks for your kind words and positive feedback for the tool our team developed, and (shameless plug alert) a reminder that we\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre still happy to share with any institution who are interested in using it.<br><br>All the best,<br><br>Trav.   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-06T01:41:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Travis Cox</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;9246565d.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;3513fc65.1503">   <title>Re: eSync integration for Adobe Connect - any users out there? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;3513fc65.1503</link>   <description> eSync is supposed to work from Instructure Canvas via LTI - seems no reason<br>it won't work with Blackboard LTI.<br><br>Can you get a test eSynch account and we can try it?<br><br>Paul<br><br>On 5 March 2015 at 15:36, Graham F McElearney &lt;g.mcelearney@sheffield.ac.uk&gt;<br>wrote:<br><br>&gt; Dear Colleagues,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; We are looking at going for a hosted concurrent user model for Adobe<br>&gt; Connect - largely so that we can take advantage of a Blackboard integration<br>&gt; for webinar administration. The Meeting One integration only works for on<br>> premise installation sof Connect, and we want to go hosted. Has [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T16:15:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Paul J Leman</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;3513fc65.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;cee6ff53.1503">   <title>eSync integration for Adobe Connect - any users out there? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;cee6ff53.1503</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>We are looking at going for a hosted concurrent user model for Adobe<br>Connect - largely so that we can take advantage of a Blackboard integration<br>for webinar administration. The Meeting One integration only works for on<br>premise installation sof Connect, and we want to go hosted. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T14:40:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Boon, Chris</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;e659e0f1.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;155cbfeb.1503">   <title>Re: Viewer access to courses </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;155cbfeb.1503</link>   <description> Hi All,<br><br>&quot;We have made a suggestion to Blackboard that a &quot;QuickEnrol AS roleX&quot; would be a nice feature.<br>Regards<br>Joseph &quot;<br><br>Great idea Joseph!<br><br>With best wishes,<br><br>Ashley Wright<br><br>Development Officer,<br>Learning &amp; Teaching Development Service- http://www.ncl.ac.uk/ltds<br><br>[cid:image001.png@01CFA1B3.17140680]<br><br>Tel (Direct line): +44 (0)191 208 5565<br><br>TEL Blog: https://blogs.ncl.ac.uk/tel/category/blackboard/<br><br>From: Blackboard/Courseinfo userslist [mailto:BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Joseph Gliddon<br>Sent: 02 March 2015 12:40<br>To: BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Viewer access to courses [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T12:52:56+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ashley Wright</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;155cbfeb.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;7f19c814.1503">   <title>Re: Viewer access to courses </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;7f19c814.1503</link>   <description> Dear Kate<br>We have approached this problem in 2 ways.<br>First the - *add to some courses as a student*.<br>We created a role called &quot;staff read only&quot; (its a copy of course builder<br>with pretty much every single right removed). The role sees the course<br>almost exactly like a student but they dont appear in the grade center<br>(also they cant take assignments or tests).<br>Our admin staff can add people to courses with this role if there is a need<br>*Drawback - *If someone is added to a large number of courses they tend to<br>get lots of [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T12:40:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Joseph Gliddon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;7f19c814.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;db958969.1503">   <title>Re: Viewer access to courses </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;db958969.1503</link>   <description> Hi Kate,<br><br>You could just enrol them as staff members to every course in their department and then they could use the student preview tool to view each course as a student.<br><br>Mark<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: Blackboard/Courseinfo userslist [mailto:BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Kate Wright<br>Sent: 02 March 2015 11:28<br>To: BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Viewer access to courses<br><br>Dear all [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T12:14:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mark Hodgson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;db958969.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;22a5cdfb.1503">   <title>Viewer access to courses </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;22a5cdfb.1503</link>   <description> Dear all<br><br>One of the things that our institutional technology-enhanced learning committee have asked us to look into is allowing staff in a department to view all the Blackboard courses in their department as if they were a student.<br><br>Has anyone done anything like this? We don't really want to enroll them as students (because of the Grade Centre etc). We do have Blackboard Community so it may be that we can do something clever with hierarchies. If anyone has got a solution that they would be willing to share we would be very grateful. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T11:28:24+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kate Wright</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BLACKBOARD-USERGROUP;22a5cdfb.1503</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
